channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023081624
item.description:
Report X-2023081624

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the box in the hazmat cage, upon inspection found the box damaged. once opened found that one of four glass bottles of methanol has broken and spilled out its contents. the box the box does look as if it were dropped or crushed hard on one side. this is on the same side as the damaged bottle. DescribePack: there is a dent in the box just over halfway up it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: all was put into a plastic spill bag and then into a hazmat tote, lastly into the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023081570
item.description:
Report X-2023081570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was discovered in hazmat cage wet and leaking. Hazmat was placed into a black bin with a plastic liner. DescribePack: Cap on one of the 4gal bottles was loose and allowed material to spill. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in a black bin with plastic liner to contain spillage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All was put into a plastic spill bag inside a black tote and then into the hazmat cage.
